intro: Serratula daurica, commonly known as Daurian sow-thistle, is a perennial herb native to eastern Asia. It features a basal rosette of smooth, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers in branched clusters. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and is often found in disturbed soils, meadows, and along roadsides. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Serratula daurica is valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
